    Craig came to the Caylor Lab as a rising senior from Rider University, majoring in Environmental Science and minoring in Biology. In the summer of 2014, Craig worked with Cynthia, looking at foliar uptake in Colocasia Esculenta using isotopically labelled water and an array of isotope analysis. Craig also helped Adam with the fieldwork at Silas Little, as you can see in the picture on the left.

    Craig is now working for the environmental consulting group EarthRes.

    Updated: July 29, 2014
